content: Yikes!To think there are already cases in California and Texas! NOTE:This is a retitled older thread, please go to the next page or the newest post for the latest update ++http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090425/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/med_swine_flu quote: Mexico fights swine flu with 'pandemic potential' By MARK STEVENSON, Associated Press Writer Mark Stevenson, Associated Press Writer 43 mins ago MEXICO CITY – A new swine flu strain that has killed as many as 68 people and sickened more than 1,000 across Mexico has "pandemic potential," the World Health Organization chief said Saturday, and it may be too late to contain the sudden outbreak. The disease has already reached Texas and California, and with 24 new suspected cases reported Saturday in Mexico City alone, schools were closed and all public events suspended in the capital until further notice — including more than 500 concerts and other gatherings in the metropolis of 20 million. A hot line fielded 2,366 calls in its first hours from frightened city residents who suspected they might have the disease. Soldiers and health workers handed out masks at subway stops, and hospitals dealt with crowds of people seeking help. The World Health Organization's director-general, Margaret Chan, said the outbreak of the never-before-seen virus is a very serious situation and has "pandemic potential." But she said it is still too early to tell if it would become a worldwide outbreak. (...) Mexican President Felipe Calderon said his government only discovered the nature of the virus late Thursday, with the help of international laboratories. "We are doing everything necessary," he said in a brief statement. (...) Associated Press Writers David Koop and Peter Orsi in Mexico City; Frank Jordans in Geneva; Mike Stobbe in Atlanta; Malcolm Ritter in New York; and Maria Cheng in London contributed to this report. This message has been edited. Last edited by: Canuck_Centaur, Thu 11 June 2009 08:00 AM
quote: Mexico fights swine flu with 'pandemic potential' By MARK STEVENSON, Associated Press Writer Mark Stevenson, Associated Press Writer 43 mins ago MEXICO CITY – A new swine flu strain that has killed as many as 68 people and sickened more than 1,000 across Mexico has "pandemic potential," the World Health Organization chief said Saturday, and it may be too late to contain the sudden outbreak. The disease has already reached Texas and California, and with 24 new suspected cases reported Saturday in Mexico City alone, schools were closed and all public events suspended in the capital until further notice — including more than 500 concerts and other gatherings in the metropolis of 20 million. A hot line fielded 2,366 calls in its first hours from frightened city residents who suspected they might have the disease. Soldiers and health workers handed out masks at subway stops, and hospitals dealt with crowds of people seeking help. The World Health Organization's director-general, Margaret Chan, said the outbreak of the never-before-seen virus is a very serious situation and has "pandemic potential." But she said it is still too early to tell if it would become a worldwide outbreak. (...) Mexican President Felipe Calderon said his government only discovered the nature of the virus late Thursday, with the help of international laboratories. "We are doing everything necessary," he said in a brief statement. (...) Associated Press Writers David Koop and Peter Orsi in Mexico City; Frank Jordans in Geneva; Mike Stobbe in Atlanta; Malcolm Ritter in New York; and Maria Cheng in London contributed to this report.

content: So far this seems to be a bunch of crapola about little to nothing, hell we have 80 or more people die an hour on highways in America and it isn't called a "pandemic". The news did the same thing with SARS (the "mysterious disease" that would kill us all), Avian flu, etc. To no avail. Conspiracy theory of the day: The swine flu "pandemic" is nothing more than an attempt to scare the American public into approving a universal healthcare system. In a few months we will hear that the only way to combat this disease will have all hospitals work together, share patient information, demographics, drugs etc. The only way to do this is to unite the healthcare system under one "command"... Mark my words this will be used as an yet another excuse to federalize our healthcare system.

content: If this becomes a major pandemic, and instead of the benighn flu that we've been seeing in New York, a really serious "1918" type flu, you will indeed see massive government action and coordination. And you will see that because there's no other way to fight such diseases. While it will be a "Socialist" response, that response will NOT be Socialism. It will be common sense. You guys must be Very VERY young. When I was a kid in the early fifties, the government intervened MASSIVELY to fight polio. ALl of us got free or low cost vaccinations. Treatment and health teams scoured the country. Any use of a Pandemic to push a political agenda is of course wrong - On the other hand, to make believe that you fight epidemics on the basis of, "you're all on your own, you should have made better choices," is just plain STUPID. Dave

content: So far this seems to be a bunch of crapola about little to nothing, hell we have 80 or more people die an hour on highways in America and it isn't called a "pandemic". The news did the same thing with SARS (the "mysterious disease" that would kill us all), Avian flu, etc. To no avail. Conspiracy theory of the day: The swine flu "pandemic" is nothing more than an attempt to scare the American public into approving a universal healthcare system. In a few months we will hear that the only way to combat this disease will have all hospitals work together, share patient information, demographics, drugs etc. The only way to do this is to unite the healthcare system under one "command"... Mark my words this will be used as an yet another excuse to federalize our healthcare system.

content: If this becomes a major pandemic, and instead of the benighn flu that we've been seeing in New York, a really serious "1918" type flu, you will indeed see massive government action and coordination. And you will see that because there's no other way to fight such diseases. While it will be a "Socialist" response, that response will NOT be Socialism. It will be common sense. You guys must be Very VERY young. When I was a kid in the early fifties, the government intervened MASSIVELY to fight polio. ALl of us got free or low cost vaccinations. Treatment and health teams scoured the country. Any use of a Pandemic to push a political agenda is of course wrong - On the other hand, to make believe that you fight epidemics on the basis of, "you're all on your own, you should have made better choices," is just plain STUPID. Dave
